revised_title: Sea-Shells as a Sustainable Agricultural Resource in Ireland
tldr: The author describes the practice of using sea-shells as a natural fertilizer for improving soil quality and increasing crop yields in Ireland. Sea-shells, particularly those from the Bay of Londonderry, are collected, dried, and spread over the land to improve soil fertility and texture. This method has been used for centuries and has proven to be effective, sustainable, and environmentally friendly. The author also discusses the historical context of this practice and its impact on the landscape and people of Ireland.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Management
